content.description: Loooong, pretty fun and tricky.  On the Double Trouble boulder just on the other side.  Start in crack.  Traverse right through the crux.  Climb a fairly moderate slab to gain the second tier and finish up the arete (same one Double Trouble finishes on).
content.location: Double Trouble Boulder/Spire.  From Purple Haze Boulder walk uphill and just right.. it’s a prominent spire at the base of the cliff.  This faces east.

content.description: From an obvious jug, climb the striking arete.  The direct version stays very true to the arete and is quite airy.  The other version stays slightly right, using the arete and more face holds, and is also airy.  If you traverse in from the Social Distancing start it likely adds a grade (FA Evan Stoddard?)
content.location: On Double Trouble Spire facing east.

climbs.name: Double Trouble
climbs.fa: Ian CB probably/ Evan Stoddard via the direct.

content.description: Start matched on a slanting rail.  A few tricky moves up the arete gets you a good hold.  Move left, through seams and a long move to a better hold.  Gain the crack left, then keep going left utilizing a couple thin holds and a pinch.  Gain the arete and easily top out the spire.  Long and really fun I think.  Not so dangerous feeling, though with the double tiered landing it deserves some caution. The direct crack finish has also been done which definitely ups the danger level a bit, though is about the same difficulty.
content.location: At the base of the Major Mass cliff.  A ways downhill and east of The Ghost.  On a prominent spire right at the base of the cliff, the start faces west.

content.description: A detached pillar at the lower level of Major Mass, just above the talus and just below Archway Cookie and TM Overhang.
